title: Isla Fisher suffers bad hair day in LA... after husband Sacha Baron Cohen blasts Mark Zuckerberg
text:
Arrested Development actress Isla Fisher suffered a bad hair day as she grabbed lunch in Los Angeles' Studio City neighborhood on Tuesday.

The 43-year-old SAG Award nominee - who relies on stylist Micah Schifman - was glued to her pink phone while clad in a green floral frock and Birkenstock sandals.

Last week, Isla wished her husband Sacha Baron Cohen a happy 48th birthday for the amusement of her 1.4M Instagram followers.

Out and about: The 43-year-old SAG Award nominee - who relies on stylist Micah Schifman - was glued to her pink phone while clad in a green floral frock and Birkenstock sandals

'Happy birthday to the man who has everything,' Fisher captioned a red carpet snap of the Brothers Grimsby couple posing with Salma Hayek.

'...except Salma Hayek!'

The Australian daughter of Scottish parents originally met the Hammersmith-born Englishman at a 2002 party in Sydney, and she converted to Judaism before their 2010 wedding.

Isla and Sacha are the proud parents of 12-year-old daughter Olive, nine-year-old daughter Elula Lottie Miriam, and four-year-old son Montgomery Moses Brian.

Last Friday, Cohen blasted Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg for his 'disingenuous' address at Georgetown University.

'He is not the government, but the owner of a private business and not subject to the 1st Amendment!' the Oscar-nominated writer wrote to his 4.3M social media following.

'If he owned a fancy restaurant and 4 neo-Nazis came goose-stepping into the dining room and were talking loudly about wanting to kill "Jewish scum," would he serve them an elegant eight course meal?

'He is not subject to the 1st Amendment!' Last Friday, Cohen blasted Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg for his 'disingenuous' address at Georgetown University

The Oscar-nominated writer wrote: 'If he owned a fancy restaurant and 4 neo-Nazis came goose-stepping into the dining room and were talking loudly about wanting to kill "Jewish scum," would he serve them an elegant eight course meal? Or would tell them to get the f*** out of his restaurant? It's the same thing. He has every legal right, indeed a moral duty, to tell them to get the f*** out of his restaurant'

British fans can finally catch Fisher as Matthew McConaughey's wealthy onscreen wife Minnie in Harmony Korine's box office bomb, The Beach Bum, when it hits UK theaters this Friday.

And in August, the 5ft3in redhead wrapped her role as Ruth Condomine in Edward Hall's period comedy Blithe Spirit - hitting UK theaters May 1 - alongside Judi Dench, Emilia Fox, and Dan Stevens.
